templates.template: <<SELF>> is not the <preposition> that indicates the affected subject. Look up the <NOUN> <<HEAD>> in the dictionary and find the appropriate <preposition>.
<<SELF>> is not the <preposition> to be used with the <intransitive verb>. You should use the <preposition> <<CORRECTED>> with the <VERB> <<HEAD>>.
<<SELF>> is not the correct <preposition> to be used with the <adjective> <<HEAD>>. Look up the <adjective> <<HEAD>> in a dictionary to learn the appropriate <preposition> to be used.

When the <verb> <<HEAD>> is used as an <intransitive verb>, a <preposition> needs to precede the what is being thought about. Look up the <verb> <<HEAD>> in the dictionary to find the appropriate preposition.
When a <noun> is qualified by another <noun> that follows, a <preposition> is necessary between the two nouns. Think of the most common <preposition> of association.
While the <conjunction> <<HEAD>> is used as it is when preceding a <clause>, the <preposition> <<SELF>> is necessary when preceding a <noun phrase>.
As the <verb> <<HEAD>> is an <intransitive verb>, it does not take a <direct object>. Look up the <verb> <<HEAD>> in a dictionary to learn the appropriate <preposition> to be used.

other-templates.template: When the <to infinitive> <<SELF>> follows the <verb> <<HEAD>>, you should use the <-ing form> <<CORRECTED>> instead.

When the <verb> <<SELF>> is used as an <intransitive verb>, a <preposition> needs to precede the what is being thought about. Instead use <<CORRECTED>> as it does not require a <preposition> while meaning the same.
The noun <<SELF>> in the subject position is incorrect in number. <<EXPLAIN>> Replace it with the appropriate singular/plural form.
A preposition is missing before the object of preposition <<SELF>>. Consider adding the appropriate preposition to connect it to the sentence.
The adjectival complement <<SELF>> is not the correct choice. <<EXPLAIN>> Consider replacing it with a more suitable adjective.
The open clausal complement verb <<SELF>> has an incorrect form. <<EXPLAIN>> Replace it with the correct verb form.
The negation modifier <<SELF>> is unnecessary or redundant in this context. Removing it would make the sentence correct or more fluent.
A conjunction is missing before the verb <<SELF>>. Consider adding the appropriate coordinating or subordinating conjunction to connect the clauses.
The preposition <<SELF>> is not the correct choice in this context. Consider replacing it with a more suitable preposition to convey the intended meaning.
The appositional modifier <<SELF>> is unnecessary or redundant in this context. Removing it would make the sentence correct or more fluent.
The pronoun <<SELF>> used as the subject is not appropriate. <<EXPLAIN>> Replace it with the correct pronoun.
A verb is missing in the clausal complement. Consider adding the appropriate verb to complete the meaning of the sentence.
